New Records: Anthony Volpe became the first player in World Series history to log four RBIs and two steals in a game.
Freddie Freeman extended his personal World Series homer streak to a record-setting six games, dating back to 2021 with the Braves.
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe hit a go-ahead grand slam off Dodgers reliever Daniel Hudson in the third inning.
Austin Wells and Gleyber Torres hit late-inning home runs for the Yankees.
Freddie Freeman hit a two-run home run in the first inning.
Will Smith hit a leadoff homer in the fifth inning for the Dodgers.
Mark Leiter Jr. struck out Shohei Ohtani and Luke Weaver struck out Mookie Betts with a runner at second in the seventh inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Volpe expressed pride in the team's resilience, stating 'We're not going to go down easy at all.'
Yankees manager Aaron Boone commented on the energy at Yankee Stadium, saying 'You finally got to see the top blow off Yankee Stadium in a World Series game.'
Dodgers skipper Dave Roberts reflected on the game, stating 'I don't think anyone expected [the Yankees] to lay down.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees are the first team to force a Game 5 when down 3-0 in a World Series since the Reds in 1970 against the Orioles.
